required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a New Post Image Processing Engine (S-Vue™) for the Reduction of Ionizing Radiation Dose on X-ray Examination in Pediatric Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a New Post Image Processing Engine (S-Vue™) for the Reduction of Ionizing Radiation Dose on X-ray Examination in Pediatric Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare X-ray images obtained using the GM85 digital radiography machine at the standard full dose to X-ray images obtained using the GM85 digital radiography machine along with the Samsung S-Vue system, which is a image post-processing engine that allows images to be obtained using a lower dose. The study also aims to determine the lowest dose of radiation that can be used to get a good, readable x-ray of the chest in pediatric patients using Samsung S-Vue system.

primary_outcome.measure: Image Quality as assessed by the Bureau of Radiological Health (BRH) method based scoring system-Anatomic landmark
primary_outcome.description: The BRH anatomic landmark score ranges from 0 to 100 with higher scores indicating better quality.

primary_outcome.measure: Image Quality as assessed by the Bureau of Radiological Health (BRH) method based scoring system-Anatomic landmark
primary_outcome.description: The BRH anatomic landmark score ranges from 0 to 100 with higher scores indicating better quality.

primary_outcome.measure: Image Quality as assessed by the Bureau of Radiological Health (BRH) method based scoring system-Physical parameters
primary_outcome.description: The BRH physical parameters score ranges from 0 to 100 with higher scores indicating better quality.

primary_outcome.measure: Image Quality as assessed by the Bureau of Radiological Health (BRH) method based scoring system-Physical parameters
primary_outcome.description: The BRH physical parameters score ranges from 0 to 100 with higher scores indicating better quality.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive a full (standard) dose chest X-ray at Day 1.
Subjects will receive a follow up X-ray at at a lower dose within 3 months after the first dose.

intervention.description: Full dose X ray at Day 1
Low dose X ray within 3 months from full dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Standard weight/height outpatients who require two X-ray exams within 3 months in the US
- BMI is >5% and < 85% for participants over the age of 2;for participants less than 2 weight for length will be measured
Exclusion Criteria:
- Obese and underweight children as defined as BMI ,<5% or >85% according the World Health Organization growth chart for participants over 2 years of age; and for participants less than 2 years of age,weight for length will be measured

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
